subtitle: A very popular Indian sweet, similar in texture to a blancmange. Flavoured with rose water, although use kewra essence if you have it.

method.text: Rinse rice. Then soak in cold water for 1 <sup>1</sup>/<sub>1</sub> days. Drain thoroughly. Add the measured water and grind the rice to a paste in a food processor or blender.
Heat the milk in a pan until just below boiling point. Stir in the rice paste. Cook for 3-5 min, stirring constantly until mixture starts to thicken. Remove from heat.
Stir in the sugar until dissolved. Return to heat. Bring to the boil and simmer for 2 min or until thickened. Remove from heat. Leave to cool.
Stir in the rose water and nuts. Spoon into a serving bowl. Chill thoroughly.
Decorate with flaked almonds and chopped pistachio nuts.

title: Phirni (Nut and almond dessert)
